name: Jose Capablanca
description: A positional and strategic genius, known for effortless precision and flawless endgame technique.

explanation.Aggressiveness: Capablanca was a calm and precise player, preferring strategic advantages over direct attacks.
explanation.RiskTaking: He avoided unnecessary risks, relying on deep positional understanding.
explanation.KingSafety: Capablanca rarely exposed his king unnecessarily, always ensuring its safety.
explanation.PieceActivity: He placed his pieces optimally but did not seek hyperactivity.
explanation.PawnStructure: He played with a clean, well-structured pawn game, ensuring long-term advantages.
explanation.KnightPair: Knights were useful to him, but he didn't rely on them heavily.
explanation.BishopPair: Bishops played a key role in his precise positional style.
explanation.Defense: He was extremely solid, hard to beat, and rarely made blunders.
explanation.CalculationDepth: While not a deep calculator like Tal, he made highly effective moves.
explanation.EndgameKnowledge: His endgame technique was nearly perfect, making him one of the greatest in history.
explanation.PieceSacrifice: Unlike Tal, he rarely sacrificed material unless it guaranteed a clear advantage.
explanation.CenterControl: Capablanca always controlled the center with impeccable precision.
explanation.PositionClosure: He often played closed positions to outmaneuver opponents positionally.
explanation.PieceTrade: He had no problem trading pieces to simplify into winning endgames.
explanation.KingAttack: Unlike Tal, Capablanca attacked only when completely justified.
explanation.PositionalSacrifice: Sacrifices were rare, but he used them occasionally for positional advantages.
explanation.KnightVsBishop: He slightly favored bishops over knights due to their long-range power.
explanation.PawnPush: He advanced pawns carefully, favoring long-term positional benefits.
explanation.OpenFileControl: He expertly utilized open files for his rooks to maximize control.
